item.title: Managing a Raspberry Pi OpenVPN with Salt
item.description: When you successfully install something complex, and then you fail to document one small thing about how you did it, the inclination is to over-document once you get it working again; thus, this expository account of managing a set of Raspberry Pi devices using the “salt” system. It’s not a complete start to finish writeup, just a pointer to the bits that I had forgotten. This is mostly experimental at this point, and the collection of devices is relatively small.

item.title: RRDTool v1.5.4 on Raspberry Pi
item.description: The second in a series of efforts to get a suitable database for the task. The challenge is that there’s a lot of data out there that changes all the time, and you want to gather it, make sure it’s sane, squirrel it away for later analysis, put together a pretty chart so that you can spot check it, feed it into other systems not yet fully dreamed of to cause actions, and so on.
